revised_title: Development and Applications of Recuperative Burners for Gas-Fired Furnaces
tldr: This article discusses the development of recuperative burners, which combine the functions of a burner, flue, and recuperator in a single compact unit, improving fuel economy and reducing heat loss in gas-fired furnaces. The author explains the technical challenges and the use of mathematical and physical modeling techniques to predict performance and test the burner's reliability. The burner has been successfully applied to various furnace types, leading to significant energy savings and reduced costs.
